item.title: Feature Overview
item.description: floki aims to provide reproducible and shareable build tooling. It does this by helping you run docker containers interactively from a declarative yaml file. The ideal workflow is clone the source repository run floki get to work floki has a number of features to help achieve this. The following outlines these features. Container images floki offers a couple of ways to configure the container image to use.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation Prerequisites It’s recommended you add your user to the docker group: $ sudo usermod -a -G docker USERNAME and logout and in again to pick up the changes. Alternatively you can run floki (after installation) with sudo -E floki. Installation from pre-built binaries Precompiled binaries for linux and OSX can be downloaded from the releases page.
